required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Impacts of Fruit on the Gut Health and Human Health
clinical_study.official_title: An Investigation of the Impact of Fruit on the Gut Microbiota and Its Metabolites: Connections to Human Health

brief_summary.textblock: The objectives of this study are to investigate the effect of fruit consumption on the gut microbiota and their collective fecal and plasma metabolomes, vascular and cardiometabolic functions, cognition, and motor control.

detailed_description.textblock: The Investigators findings will provide data critical to the understanding of the effects of fruit intake on the gut microbiome and the capacity of the microbiota to biotransform nutrients contained within fruits as well as the subsequent impact on circulating status of those metabolites. Concurrently, health outcomes that may be linked to these changes including cognition, motor control, vascular function and cardiometabolic health risk markers will be assessed in healthy adults.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in composition of bacterial fecal microbiome at 8 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Bacterial fecal microbiome 16S rRNA gene amplicon libraries will be sequence using the Illumina MiSeq next generation sequencing platform.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in processing speed (cognition) at 8 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: using Pattern Comparison Processing Speed Test

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Vascular health at 8 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: To better understand how changes in the gut microbiota through fruit consumption are linked to changes in health outcomes, we will assess endothelial function via flow-mediated vasodilation and risk factors for cardiometabolic dysfunction in fasting blood samples collected at baseline and after 8 weeks.

arm_group.description: Participants will receive 2 cup eq fruits per day
Participants will receive 1/2 cup eq fruits per day

intervention.description: participants will receive 2 cup eq fruits
participants will receive 1/2 cups eq fruits

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy men and women 30 to 70 years old
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of:
- stroke or myocardial infarction
- gastrointestinal disorders
- neurological disorders (epilepsy, multiple sclerosis, Parkinson's disease, stroke, etc)
- known metabolic disorders (liver, renal or clinically diagnosed diabetes)
- drug treatment for lipid reduction or hypertension,
- psychiatric medication use
